title: Football Society Intro
description:
E507 Studio commissioned me to create an intro for Football Society, a podcast dedicated to a romantic vision of football, including passion, anecdotes, and football culture. The style had to stand out from typical football shows and reflect the podcast’s unique character.
I worked on bringing the client’s core idea to life (a mug being hit by a football) as well as adding sound effects and selecting the music.

title: Growermetal Open Day
description:
E507 Studio commissioned me to create a short video for Growermetal, a major company producing washers. The video was made for an Open Day, when the workers’ families were invited to visit the factory. It’s a fun and easy explanation of what Growermetal does and how washers are made.
I took care of the illustrations and animations, while the client provided the script.

title: Billy Bruco
description:
During my university internship at Watermelon, I created a series of three animated video loops as a playful symbol of our collaboration. Designed for Instagram, the project features Billy Bruco, a cheerful little caterpillar with a big appetite.
I developed the concept, illustrations, motion design, and sound design independently, with valuable feedback and support from the studio.

title: (Against) The Noise Machine
description:
A conceptual design project exploring the cultural suppression of silence through a speculative dystopia.
(Against) The Noise Machine blends video, editorial design, web and audio to question the normalization of constant noise.

blocks.title: (Against) The Noise Machine
blocks.content:
In today’s culture, silence is not just overlooked. It is actively dismantled. A culture that eliminates silence is a culture that loses a fundamental part of the human experience. Silence is not just an empty space between words. It is what allows us to hear them, feel them, understand them.

Its disappearance is not neutral. It is a symbolic, cognitive, and political loss. And ironically, it often goes unnoticed.

With this project, I aim to make that absence visible. To show how noise, especially in its most pervasive modern form (communication) has taken on a role of constant saturation. It blocks reflection, numbs thought, and narrows our sense of freedom.

From personal experience to cultural narrative. This thesis takes an interdisciplinary approach, combining theoretical analysis, creative storytelling, and visual design.

Silence is explored on multiple levels: as a psychological and cultural phenomenon, as a narrative device, and as a design tool in the field of contemporary communication. The goal is to build an argument that is both critical and engaging. One that shows the issue, not just explains it.

I created a dystopian world called The Noise Machine, where silence has been outlawed. Through this fictional lens, I aim to give metaphorical and emotional form to the dynamics explored earlier.

title: Flor.es
description:
Visual identity and UI/UX design for Flor.es, an app that allows users to remotely monitor and control indoor cultivation systems of any scale.
Developed a complete design system, including a custom icon set and a friendly mascot named Florenzio, who guides users through the app with helpful tips and a touch of personality.

title: Apatia
description:
This video was part of a group project structured around four emotional states: euphoria, anger, despair, and apathy.
I was in charge of the final segment, "Apatia", which served as the closing chapter. Through a slow, dreamlike pace and abstract sound, I aimed to convey a sense of emotional numbness and detachment. I pictured a character who is physically present but mentally adrift.

title: Momo
description:
An illustrated book adaptation of Momo by Michael Ende. Aimed at children and young readers, the book explores the concept of time through the story of a girl who listens deeply and helps others reclaim their stolen moments from the mysterious "Grey Men."
The visual approach reflects the story’s dual nature, both playful and profound, combining imperfect, childlike forms with more detailed focal elements. Text and illustration are tightly integrated across the layout, with dynamic interactions and occasional double-page spreads designed to enhance immersion and emotional resonance.

title: Creativity
description: A short video featuring a talking character. I was given complete creative freedom in choosing the style, and I decided to use John Cleese’s speech on creativity as the basis for my project.

The client provided the base audio and a general storyline.

title: Mentalisti
description:
E507 Studio commissioned me to create motion videos for the second and third episodes of ‘Mentalisti,’ an event series hosted by the studio.
Each video highlights a distinct element inspired by the evening’s featured artist, with the studio providing the base promotional poster design and general graphic style.
